Name: Sana Klinikum Hameln-Pyrmont
Kommentare:
(Translated by Google) Recently admitted to Sana after dizziness and a brief faint at work. 10 minutes after arrival I was asked if I want to stay overnight or if I want to leave. At the time, no tests had been done and I didn't know what was wrong with me.

I got an infusion, waited 3 hours and got the information from another doctor that I should go from the emergency room to the waiting area because I was feeling better. When I was told that I still had accesses in the crook of my arm, I received the information that they will only be pulled when I actually leave.

Then at some point the emergency room doctor came and held out a slip of paper that I was asked to sign: "Patient leaves the hospital against the advice of the doctors" ... The doctor could not answer any questions about this because he was on the phone. He just waved it off. Shocked by it and because I didn't know what to do, I completely forgot about the additions. I then pulled it myself at home.

The 2nd star is only for the young trainee who offered a glass of water in between and independently inquired about the status of my blood values ​​and told me about it. Thanks for that!

Otherwise I always prefer the hospital in Gehrden in the future.

(Original)
